item.title: Survival of the luckiest? New study hints at the potential role of luck in evolution
item.description: A new study on mice shows that luck in early life can determine success as an adult, especially when competition is high.

item.title: How did surviving cancer shape your life? We want to hear from you
item.description: Living through cancer can change you — it puts pressure on everything, from your relationships to your career to your sense of self. Share how it's affected you and advice you'd give to others.

item.title: Bezos' Blue Origin is nearing liftoff on the 1st flight of its newest, biggest rocket
item.description: New Glenn, developed by the private space firm founded by billionaire Jeff Bezos, is on the pad at Cape Canaveral, Fla., and could launch on its maiden flight as early as Friday.

item.title: Winter illnesses return with a vengeance
item.description: The annual winter respiratory virus season is in full force. The number of people catching the flu is skyrocketing, while COVID-19, RSV and other respiratory viral illnesses are also rising.

item.title: As winter storms strike, airlines scramble to de-ice planes and keep them flying
item.description: A pair of powerful major winter storms is disrupting the U.S. air travel system this week. That leaves airlines no choice but to de-ice their planes before takeoff to keep them in the air.

item.title: A wage hike for home health care workers in Nevada is proving game-changing
item.description: After Nevada gave home health care workers a huge raise, from about $11 to $16 an hour, turnover in the industry fell sharply. Now, caregivers are preparing to lobby for another wage hike.
